column4: Hi .. have a n00b query ... I did a partial upgrade on my ubuntu system (9.10) ... was asked for a restart (which I did) .. but since then the system doesn't boot back ... I see a grub interface, but even the recovery mode says "could not mount filesystem"
if you boot into a liveCD can you see your files?

I can .. but it seems my hard disk is password protected and it doesn't accept the (usual) password I gave .. also on using the command line at grub and "ls" I can see all my files .. so I think all my files are ok
I don't think my hard disk is corrupted
password protetected, as in a password on grub, a password on the account or encryption?
grease can you get a root terminal and type cat /etc/fstab ?
I am logged here using a different computer .. how do I paste the contents of /etc/fstab to the website from the grub terminal ?
was afk for longer...than i expected
no problem .. i pasted the /etc/fstab contents ( http://pastebin.com/mdbcd46e )
think the trouble is because the last few lines I had added (for VirtualBox) .. Is there a way to delete it from grub command line?
